intro: Saccolabium helferi, commonly known as the Helfer's saccolabium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep root systems that help it access water from deeper soil layers. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
